data.title: News today from Switzerland
data.meta_description: Stay updated with the latest news from Switzerland. Get insights into Swiss politics, culture, economy, and more.
data.text:
More

Swiss government scrambles to deal with egg shortage

This content was published on From September 1, more eggs intended for consumption may be imported into Switzerland. In allowing this, the government wants to secure the supply of eggs for consumers.

Read more: Swiss government scrambles to deal with egg shortage

More

Number of Swiss shops increases despite online competition

This content was published on Over the past ten years the number of bricks-and-mortar retail stores in Switzerland has increased.

Read more: Number of Swiss shops increases despite online competition

More

Swiss government proposes financing 13th pension payment with higher VAT

This content was published on The 13th monthly pension payment is to be financed by higher value-added tax (VAT), the Swiss government proposes.

Read more: Swiss government proposes financing 13th pension payment with higher VAT

More

Switzerland must adapt laws due to EU asylum and migration pact

This content was published on Switzerland wants to adopt parts of the EU asylum and migration pact.

Read more: Switzerland must adapt laws due to EU asylum and migration pact

More

Health insurance cold callers banned in Switzerland

This content was published on Health insurance companies are no longer allowed to make unwanted calls to potential customers.

Read more: Health insurance cold callers banned in Switzerland

More

Local demand increases for Swiss sparkling wines

This content was published on Agricultural research sees new development opportunities for Swiss sparkling wines in the face of declining wine consumption. In a survey, half of consumers expressed a willingness to pay more for local products than for foreign ones.

Read more: Local demand increases for Swiss sparkling wines

More

Locarno spotlights filmmakers from South America and Caribbean

This content was published on The Open Doors section of the Locarno Film Festival has named the winners for 2024. The spotlight is on the South American and Caribbean regions.

Read more: Locarno spotlights filmmakers from South America and Caribbean

More

Storm paralyses trains to popular Swiss tourist resort

This content was published on The railway line between Zweilütschinen and Grindelwald in central Switzerland is expected to remain closed until Friday following heavy rains.

Read more: Storm paralyses trains to popular Swiss tourist resort

More

Historic Ju-52 plane grounded permanently in Switzerland

This content was published on The Ju-52 aircraft belonging to the Ju-Air association will remain in the aviation museum in Dübendorf, canton Zurich.

Read more: Historic Ju-52 plane grounded permanently in Switzerland

More

UBS posts billions in profit and presses ahead with Credit Suisse integration

This content was published on The bank believes it is well on track with its integration efforts and the targeted cost savings.

Read more: UBS posts billions in profit and presses ahead with Credit Suisse integration

More

Italian businessman arrested in Brazil in mafia investigation

This content was published on An Italian businessman has been arrested in the Brazilian city of Natal as part of an international investigation into a mafia network worth an estimated €500 million.

Read more: Italian businessman arrested in Brazil in mafia investigation

More

Swiss government explains recommended rejection of biodiversity initiative

This content was published on The government recommends that people vote no to the biodiversity initiative on September 22.

Read more: Swiss government explains recommended rejection of biodiversity initiative

More

Swiss storms force evacuation of 70 people in Brienz

This content was published on Storms sweep through parts of Switzerland.

Read more: Swiss storms force evacuation of 70 people in Brienz

More

Vodafone Italia: Swisscom notifies Italian competition commission

This content was published on Swisscom has filed a formal notification with the Italian competition authority concerning its mid-March acquisition of Vodafone Italia.

Read more: Vodafone Italia: Swisscom notifies Italian competition commission

More

Swiss rail police to be equipped with body cameras

This content was published on Transport police hope cameras will help defuse conflicts.

Read more: Swiss rail police to be equipped with body cameras

More

Probe launched after alleged murder by Swiss psychiatric patient

This content was published on Repeat offender suspected of committing crime during unaccompanied outing from clinic.

Read more: Probe launched after alleged murder by Swiss psychiatric patient

More

Rome and Bern adopt joint declaration on Ukraine

This content was published on Foreign Ministers express “deep concern” at “continuing aggression” in Ukraine.

Read more: Rome and Bern adopt joint declaration on Ukraine

More

Malfunction forces partial shutdown of Swiss nuclear plant

This content was published on Reactor number one at the Beznau nuclear power plant disconnected from the grid.

Read more: Malfunction forces partial shutdown of Swiss nuclear plant

More

Large Swiss companies reduced their CO2 emissions

This content was published on Major Swiss companies have reduced their CO2 emissions over the past two years.

Read more: Large Swiss companies reduced their CO2 emissions
